headline: Microsoft’s (NASDAQ:MSFT) Q4 CY2025 Sales Top Estimates
summary: Technology giant Microsoft (NASDAQ:MSFT) reported revenue ahead of Wall Streets expectations in Q4 CY2025, with sales up 16.7% year on year to $81.27 billion. Its GAAP profit of $5.16 per share was 34.1% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Microsoft beats Wall Street expectations with $81.3B revenue
summary: Microsoft said Wednesday that its revenue for the October-December quarter was $81.3 billion, up 17% from the same time last year and beating Wall Street expectations.  The company reported net profit for the quarter of $30.9 billion, or $4.14 per share, also beating Wall Street expectations.  Microsoft was expected to earn $3.91 per share on revenue of $80.31 billion for the October-December quarter, according to analysts surveyed by FactSet Research.

raw.headline: Microsoft beats Wall Street expectations with $81.3B revenue
raw.summary: Microsoft said Wednesday that its revenue for the October-December quarter was $81.3 billion, up 17% from the same time last year and beating Wall Street expectations.  The company reported net profit for the quarter of $30.9 billion, or $4.14 per share, also beating Wall Street expectations.  Microsoft was expected to earn $3.91 per share on revenue of $80.31 billion for the October-December quarter, according to analysts surveyed by FactSet Research.

headline: Microsoft outpaces Q2 estimates. But the stock is falling.
summary: Microsoft (MSFT) stock is sinking in Wednesday's extended hours trading after the tech giant reported adjusted earnings of $5.16 per share and revenue figures ($81.27 billion vs. estimates of $80.31 billion) that topped Wall Street expectations.Market Domination Overtime Host Josh Lipton dives into Microsoft's earnings release with Yahoo Finance Tech Editor Dan Howley, including the tech giant's Azure cloud business revenue.To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination Overtime.

headline: Microsoft's rising spending, slight cloud beat fan AI payoff worries
summary: Microsoft only edged past estimates for quarterly revenue in its crucial cloud-computing business on Wednesday and ramped up spending on artificial intelligence, disappointing investors looking for ​better returns amid intense competition.  The company also reported that ‌the contracted backlog in its cloud business more than doubled to $625 billion, which was more than the $523 billion rival Oracle posted ‌in December.  But roughly 45% of Microsoft's backlog was driven by OpenAI alone, underscoring its reliance on the money-losing startup that has pledged around $1.4 trillion in overall AI expenditure with little details on how it plans to fund the spending.

raw.headline: Microsoft's rising spending, slight cloud beat fan AI payoff worries
raw.summary: Microsoft only edged past estimates for quarterly revenue in its crucial cloud-computing business on Wednesday and ramped up spending on artificial intelligence, disappointing investors looking for ​better returns amid intense competition.  The company also reported that ‌the contracted backlog in its cloud business more than doubled to $625 billion, which was more than the $523 billion rival Oracle posted ‌in December.  But roughly 45% of Microsoft's backlog was driven by OpenAI alone, underscoring its reliance on the money-losing startup that has pledged around $1.4 trillion in overall AI expenditure with little details on how it plans to fund the spending.

headline: Fed Rate-Cut Pause May Last With Economy On 'Firm Footing'; S&P 500 Wavers (Live Coverage)
summary: The Federal Reserve left interest rates unchanged, as expected, but made a slightly hawkish adjustment to its policy statement.  Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell said both labor market and inflation risks have diminished, after previously prioritizing a cooling labor market.  Powell signaled a longer rate pause, saying that policy is "well-positioned here."

Markets could swing during Chairman Jerome Powell's 2:30 p.m. ET news conference.  The S&P 500 remained slightly lower shortly after the 2 p.m. ET policy statement on Wednesday after eking out a record closing high on Tuesday.

headline: Amazon’s Second Massive Layoff in 4 Months Signals Permanent Shift in Tech Labor Strategy
summary: Amazon (NASDAQ:AMZN) just announced 16,000 job cuts worldwide, the second massive layoff in four months following 14,000 cuts in October. Combined, that’s 30,000 corporate roles eliminated in 120 days. This isn’t cost-cutting in response to a downturn. It’s a permanent recalibration of how tech giants view labor in the age of AI. The pattern across ... Amazon’s Second Massive Layoff in 4 Months Signals Permanent Shift in Tech Labor Strategy

headline: Fed Meeting: Two Ways Powell Could Move The S&P 500 (Live Coverage)
summary: Today's Federal Reserve meeting outcome may seem to be low on suspense, with markets pricing in slim odds of a near-term rate cut.  The S&P 500 opened edged lower around noon on Wednesday after eking out a record closing high on Tuesday.  The bull market rally has continued as the U.S. dollar has fallen to a five-year low against other advanced-economy currencies, a move which President Trump has endorsed.

headline: WisdomTree’s Growth ETF Puts 14% in NVIDIA and 31% in Just Six Stocks

headline: Microsoft Maia 200 AI Chip Underscores Long Term Growth Story
summary: Microsoft (NasdaqGS:MSFT) has introduced its Maia 200 AI chip, aimed at running large scale inference workloads across its cloud and data centers. The company is extending Maia driven AI into real world uses, including robotics with Richtech Robotics and embedded payments with Elavon inside Microsoft 365. The moves are intended to deepen Microsoft’s role in AI infrastructure and practical enterprise automation. Microsoft trades at $480.58, with the share price up 5.7% over the past week...

headline: Amazon to Cut 16,000 Corporate Positions to Trim Bureaucracy
summary: The tech firm will offer US-based employees 90 days to search for a new role internally, as well as severance and other transition support, Beth Galetti, Amazon’s senior vice president of people experience and technology said Wednesday in a blog post.  Companies across industries have been trimming management layers in the name of becoming leaner and more productive.  Just as Amazon was announcing its own layoffs, the chip-making machine giant ASML Holding NV said it’s eliminating 1,700 positions largely targeting managerial roles.

headline: ASML posts record orders on AI chip demand, SK Hynix soars
summary: STORY: The AI boom showed no signs of slowing down for majors ASML and SK Hynix on Wednesday (January 28).ASML logged record orders in the fourth quarter.And the top computer chip equipment maker raised its outlook for the year as demand surged from its AI-focused customers.Fourth-quarter bookings leapt to a record $15.8 billion - well up from a year before and far ahead of analyst expectations.The firm also raised its sales guidance to between $46.8 billion to a near $54 billion - again ahead of analyst projections.Shares were up more than 4% in early trade - the stock is up close to 40% this year so far.The orders beat comes as ASML customers like Samsung and SK Hynix boost investment plans.Those firms have seen major demand for AI logic and memory chips needed by cloud computing giants like Microsoft and Google.South Korea's SK Hynix also reported record quarterly earnings Wednesday amid the AI boom.It smashed forecasts with a profit more than double its previous record.It also predicted AI demand would keep pushing explosive growth in memory chip orders.

raw.headline: ASML posts record orders on AI chip demand, SK Hynix soars
raw.summary: STORY: The AI boom showed no signs of slowing down for majors ASML and SK Hynix on Wednesday (January 28).ASML logged record orders in the fourth quarter.And the top computer chip equipment maker raised its outlook for the year as demand surged from its AI-focused customers.Fourth-quarter bookings leapt to a record $15.8 billion - well up from a year before and far ahead of analyst expectations.The firm also raised its sales guidance to between $46.8 billion to a near $54 billion - again ahead of analyst projections.Shares were up more than 4% in early trade - the stock is up close to 40% this year so far.The orders beat comes as ASML customers like Samsung and SK Hynix boost investment plans.Those firms have seen major demand for AI logic and memory chips needed by cloud computing giants like Microsoft and Google.South Korea's SK Hynix also reported record quarterly earnings Wednesday amid the AI boom.It smashed forecasts with a profit more than double its previous record.It also predicted AI demand would keep pushing explosive growth in memory chip orders.

headline: S&P 500 Builds on Record. Tech Stocks Rally Ahead of Fed Rate Call.
summary: Stocks looked set to extend their record-breaking run on Wednesday following earnings reports from two chip companies, while the dollar looked set to carry on sliding after comments from President Donald Trump sparked a brutal selloff for the greenback.  S&P 500 futures rose 0.3% after the benchmark hit a new high on Tuesday, and contracts tied to the Nasdaq gained 0.9%.  The tech-heavy index was racking up gains after semiconductor manufacturer Texas Instruments and chip tool maker ASML both issued solid guidance, which investors took as a sign that the artificial-intelligence boom still has legs.

The tech-heavy index was racking up gains after semiconductor manufacturer Texas Instruments and chip tool maker ASML both issued solid guidance, which investors took as a sign that the artificial-intelligence boom still has legs.

headline: US megacap results to test market's tech trade, profit optimism
summary: Stakes are high for earnings reports from U.S. megacap companies this week, as investors seek proof that strong profit growth will lift stocks this year, including evidence that artificial-intelligence investments are paying off.  Reports are due from Microsoft, Apple, Facebook parent ​Meta Platforms and Tesla - four of the "Magnificent Seven" megacap companies whose bottom-line results broadly are key drivers of overall U.S. profits.  The group is expected ‌to post a 21.5% rise in earnings for the quarter, compared with a 5.3% gain for the rest of the S&P 500, according to Tajinder Dhillon, head of earnings research at LSEG.

The group is expected ‌to post a 21.5% rise in earnings for the quarter, compared with a 5.3% gain for the rest of the S&P 500, according to Tajinder Dhillon, head of earnings research at LSEG.

headline: Tech Stocks Rally Ahead of Fed Rate Call. Dollar Falls After Trump Rout.
summary: Stocks looked set to extend their record-breaking run on Wednesday following earnings reports from two chip companies, while the dollar looked set to carry on sliding after comments from President Donald Trump sparked a brutal selloff for the greenback.  The tech-heavy index was racking up gains after semiconductor manufacturer Texas Instruments and chip tool maker ASML both issued solid guidance, which investors took as a sign that the artificial-intelligence boom still has legs.  The Federal Reserve is also set to make its latest policy decision–the central bank is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged, but Chair Jerome Powell’s comments could give the market a better idea of whether there’ll be scope for cuts to borrowing costs later in 2026.

The Federal Reserve is also set to make its latest policy decision–the central bank is widely expected to keep interest rates unchanged, but Chair Jerome Powell’s comments could give the market a better idea of whether there’ll be scope for cuts to borrowing costs later in 2026.

headline: Arista Networks Emerges As Key AI Data Center Ethernet Partner
summary: Arista Networks (NYSE:ANET) is being highlighted as a key infrastructure supplier in the AI data center upgrade cycle. Major hyperscalers, including Microsoft, are moving toward Ethernet based scalability for AI clusters and rolling out in house AI chips such as the Maia 200. Arista’s role in high speed Ethernet switching and its focus on software driven, open networking are central to current AI build out plans. Recent coverage also points to risks tied to heavy customer concentration,...

headline: ASML’s Record Orders Smash Estimates as AI Spurs Demand
summary: Bookings in the fourth quarter were a record €13.2 billion ($15.8 billion), driven by demand for its most sophisticated equipment, the Veldhoven, Netherlands-based company said in a statement on Wednesday.  ASML is the only producer of cutting-edge lithography machines that are needed to make advanced semiconductors, and counts all the leading chip manufacturers as customers, including Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Corp. and Intel Corp. Its machinery is integral to producing the Nvidia Corp. AI accelerators that are the backbone for training and running AI models in data centers.

headline: Top Valuation Expert Says AI Market Needs 'Trillions In Revenue' To Justify Valuations After Cashing Out Of Its Biggest Chipmaker
summary: Aswath Damodaran, the ‘Dean of Valuation,’ has issued a stark warning to AI investors that the math simply does not add up. Citing a massive disconnect between upfront infrastructure spending and future earnings, the NYU finance professor revealed he has fully exited his position in Nvidia Corp. (NASDAQ:NVDA) while maintaining his stake in Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ:MSFT). The ‘Big Market Delusion’ Damodaran argues that the current AI frenzy exhibits classic signs of a “Big Market Delusion,” a cycl

headline: Review & Preview: Shaky Confidence
